item.title: Canopy Tour in Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Canopy tour in Costa Rica are the most popular activities in the country and is a ‘MUST DO’ activity! Aside from a great adventure ride, you get to see Costa Rica’s biodiversity at its best because a lot of it [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Canopy tour in Costa Rica are the most popular activities in the country and is a ‘MUST DO’ activity! Aside from a great adventure ride, you get to see Costa Rica’s biodiversity at its best because a lot of it exists in the canopy layer. Enjoy a combo package of zip-line, aerial trams, suspension bridges, and tarzan swings. Contact us to set up a great day for you!

While zip lining in Costa Rica, you get to visit amazing ecosystems and get the bird’s eye view of bromeliads, toucans, monkeys, and sloths. Plus, the panoramic view of mountain ranges, volcanoes, and oceans make for an unforgettable experience.

Cool places for a Canopy Tour in Costa Rica:

- Arenal / La Fortuna
- Monteverde
- Jaco

How Does It Work?

There are many types of canopy tours that you can go on. Some require that you just put on a harness, attach yourself to a cable, and zip from one platform through narrow tunnels of greenery to the other. Others involve more hiking along trails that have suspension bridges with plenty of stop and gos to absorb the surroundings.

If you’re the super adventurous type, get on the 3,280-foot long Superman “sensational cable” and feel like a true superhero for the day at 55 mph! No matter the speed, it is all the same: put on a harness, hook up to a cable, leave your fears on the platform, and zoom!

Tours like this can turn a nice vacation into an unforgettable adventure. So don’t think twice, pick the company that offers these adventure tours in Costa Rica and enjoy!


Fun Things to Do – Canopy Tour in Costa Rica

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Looking for Sunglasses Over Glasses? Here’s One To Consider
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Do you struggle with sunglasses and prescription lenses? This seems to be a huge complaint for my dad who constantly is on the look for the right type of sunglasses to wear over his glasses. He tried doing the prescription glasses that [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Do you struggle with sunglasses and prescription lenses? This seems to be a huge complaint for my dad who constantly is on the look for the right type of sunglasses to wear over his glasses. He tried doing the prescription glasses that get tinted over, but he said they never get dark enough and a lot of sunlight still enters from the sides and they simply don’t make larger styled prescription glasses for him.

That’s when I decided to take matters into my own hands. Cause, frankly, I’m sick of his whining! That’s how I found Cocoons Eyewear. This company specializes in many types of sunglasses from clip ons to sunglasses that fit over all types of prescription glasses.

After contacting them personally, to get the best ones for my dad, we decided to go with the Aviator Design. What they did was send me a special guide for exactly these types of questions that help with sizes, styles and so much more.  It’s one of the most thorough, helpful guides I’ve seen. And the customer service was great with all my questions.

Features of these Sunglasses Over Glasses

Size matters – there are tons of different shapes and sizes of prescription glasses, and plenty of choices for different styles to fit over them

Polarized glasses – they are 100% polarized with all different tints for your liking. The polarization helps prevent that annoying glare and reflection.

Colored Frames – What’s your favorite color? I bet you can find the one you like most.

Fitted Temples – With glasses having to fit over the prescription ones, it’s important that they fit snugly and comfortably around your temple and ears.

360 degree protection – the glasses cover from all angles.

Accessories – it comes with a really cool case that you can clip on to anything, your pants, bag, etc…

Where to Buy them

I did all the questioning and enquiries via the website. However, they work with a ton of dealers that might work better for you.


Sunglasses Over Glasses – Cocoons Eyewear Review

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: 4 Things to do in Orlando
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Orlando is a modern city in the middle of Florida. It is famous for being home to some of the best amusement parks in the world. But there are tons of other fun things to do, and places to visit [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Orlando is a modern city in the middle of Florida. It is famous for being home to some of the best amusement parks in the world. But there are tons of other fun things to do, and places to visit in it. So don’t limit yourself to the parks on your next vacation.

Here are 4 recommendations on things to do in Orlando:

visit the Beaches – Orlando is a modern city, surrounded by beautiful beaches. You can enjoy all of the amenities of a beach destination and still have everything that you may need from a city, just steps away.
Water Parks – The city is also packed with water parks for families and people of all ages. The weather is perfect for them almost year long.
Sea World – A visit to Orlando, Florida cannot be complete without a visit to Sea World. It is a place filled with fun exhibits and the famous show of Shamu the Whale.
Festivities – What do you want? Concerts, parades, music festivals, parades, film shows, food events? Orlando has it all! So make sure you do some research about the popular events in the Orlando Area that will take place during your visit.

These are just a couple of things that you can do in Orlando. I’m sure that if you don’t like these, you will find some others with just a tiny bit of research. So dare to be different!

item.title: UV Swimwear for Kids – One Step Ahead Review
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Kids have this funny tendency, when they go swimming, to stay in a pool all day long. This makes it an impossible task to put sunscreen on them more than the initial chance. Yet the sun doesn’t get any milder. [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Kids have this funny tendency, when they go swimming, to stay in a pool all day long. This makes it an impossible task to put sunscreen on them more than the initial chance. Yet the sun doesn’t get any milder. So what to do? I decided the best solution was to get  UV swimwear for kids.

But my three year old isn’t as easy to please as most toddlers his age. I had to do some serious searching for him to want the design. One Step Ahead has quite a selection to choose from. Granted, I showed him the sun protective swimwear shirt online and by the time it arrived he had long forgotten we even bothered to do it. So I held my breath when it was time to put it on him.

It was a hit from the start. Along with not wanting to get out of the pool all day, he didn’t want to part with his shirt either. 

Fun Info on UV Swimwear for Kids

Aside from the adorable shark design here’s what the shirt really is great for:

Sun Protection – the shirt is UPF 50+ perfect for UV protection

Design – it’s longer than the usual shirt for his age, it’s made that way for better coverage

Ease of Use – you throw it on him and he doesn’t even know that he’s being protected. And to have it washed, is a quick throw in the laundry machine and it’s as good as new.

Where to Buy it

I found the buying process very easy via their website. Plus, whenever you go on it, you will almost always find a discount or special sale. So make sure to keep up with what they are doing.


UV Swimwear for Kids – One Step Ahead Review

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Costa Rica Healthcare – Public Clinics
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

While traveling we all worry about not getting sick for two reasons. No one wants to spend their vacations lying on a hotel bed and because we don’t always trust the doctors of the place we want to visit. I [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

While traveling we all worry about not getting sick for two reasons. No one wants to spend their vacations lying on a hotel bed and because we don’t always trust the doctors of the place we want to visit. I was one of those people but all of a sudden, in the middle of our trip in Cahuita, Costa Rica, my son became sick. Should I trust the Costa Rica healthcare system?

This is how we discovered what Costa Rica Healthcare is really like:

My son’s sickness really put me in a lot of trouble and proved once again that nothing is perfect. He was burning up and waking up in the middle of the night crying from a sore throat.

So I started to look for a private clinic or a doctor in Costa Rica, because of the horrible stories I had heard about public clinics in Costa Rica. But after running around looking for a private solution, I had to accept the fact that they were all closed and resigned to take my son to the public clinic.

The clinic was about 15 minutes from Cahuita and was squeaky clean. They requested for my paper works and since I’m not a resident and I do not have any formal documentation, they treated me as a tourist. They hurried let us see the next available doctor. Our experience there was awesome. The doctor was very good with kids, was fluent in English and extremely professional. We didn’t have to pay for anything, not even medicine.

Great medical service and medication for free? I was amazed at this and compared that with the situation in United States, you can easily understand our surprise and absolute gratefulness for their generosity. After this lovely experience, how I felt about the public hospitals has changed and filled my heart with great appreciation.

What I’m trying to say is if you do get sick and have to visit a public clinic in Costa Rica, know that you are in good hands!


Costa Rica Healthcare . Can you Trust Public Clinics?

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Convertible Dress – Eco Friendly Clothes from Aventura Clothing
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

What is the number one thing you look for when you start packing for your trip? Clothes that will serve many purposes, right? My most versatile piece of clothing, when I did my gap year, was a sarong. This thing [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

What is the number one thing you look for when you start packing for your trip? Clothes that will serve many purposes, right? My most versatile piece of clothing, when I did my gap year, was a sarong. This thing was good for just about anything. However, I’m older now and like to have classier clothes. Until now I didn’t even know they existed. But now I have proof – I found the perfect piece for me! 2 in 1 convertible dress. But it’s really not 2 in 1, but more like 5 in 1.

My searches for clothes usually have a lot to do with what’s important to me:

  1. I love eco clothing, it’s what I try to pick over everything else
  2. Dresses – I’m a huge skirt and dress fan
  3. Companies with a good purpose

Aventura Clothing had all these qualities and a lot more. But when I found the convertible dress, I was instantly sold!

The family run business’s motto is:  ’Helping the Earth… One garment at a time’

The fun of a Convertible Dress / Skirt

When I opened my package I was surprised to find an instructional guide to how to use the dress. At first I wasn’t sure what to do with it, but then I realized without I wouldn’t know that you can wear it in five different styles.

As with all clothes and styles not everything will work for you. Out of the five, I felt super comfortable and sexy with three:

Skirt – by far my most favorite look

Maxi Dress – Straps Around My Neck

Maxi Dress – No Straps

Where to Buy It

I found their website to be fun to navigate, addicting, and easy to shop from. Their customer service is top of the line, super helpful and great to work with!

There is no difference that eco clothing and regular clothing give you, except that you know you are doing good and helping keeping our Mother Earth healthy and happy. Go eco, it’s more fun.


Convertible Dress – Aventura Clothing Eco Clothing

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Travel Tote Bag – Holds A Lot More Than You Think
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Here’s a riddle for you – what do you get when you have two kids and two parents planning a day trip? Can’t think of anything? Here’s a clue – Too much stuff! That’s right. No matter how minimal your intentions are, [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Here’s a riddle for you – what do you get when you have two kids and two parents planning a day trip?

Can’t think of anything? Here’s a clue – Too much stuff!

That’s right. No matter how minimal your intentions are, you still end up having way too many things.

A travel tote bag is essential for my family. And after I found the sturdy, durable Mountain Khakis Carry All Tote, I feel as though most of my chaotic and organizational problems for a simple trip are covered. This way I can actually deal with the important stuff like the trip itself.

Wouldn’t life be grand if our problems would be solved so easily – by a simple search online and an even simpler click to buy the solution.  What can I say, I have to be grateful for small blessings such as this.

Features of Travel Tote Bag:

20 ounces of bag to fill with all you need. Trust me – that’s a lot of space!

Canvas material – durable and sturdy – ready for any crazy kid action

Great for a shopping bag – stop the plastic epidemic and use this bag for your weekly food shopping

As heavy as it can be, the shoulder straps make it easy to carry around.

Baby whisper – When all else fails, and your baby simply becomes a whiny little person, stuff them in.

Yes – the bag is that strong. I had no problem at all when my three year old demanded to be swung around by my parents in mid air.

My Take On It

I am in love with this bag. When I first got it, I thought, it’s way too big. It’s not practical. But now I can’t dream of it being smaller.

I wish it had some small pockets to fit keys. But I just clip them on my handles now.

Where to Buy It

When you shop via Mountain Khakis website you are privy to tons of different sales that pop up without you even knowing about it. And you get a lot of really cool colors to choose from for all their different products.

However, they also have a ton of dealers for you to choose from.

So go nuts and hope your small problems are solved as quickly as mine!


Travel Tote Bag – Mountain Khakis Review

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Child Safety Harness Alternative for Travel
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

My kids hate child harnesses and child leashes. And I keep pushing them on them. And with each push or beg, I get the same response – “I don’t like it, take it off.” I was desperate to find an [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

My kids hate child harnesses and child leashes. And I keep pushing them on them. And with each push or beg, I get the same response – “I don’t like it, take it off.” I was desperate to find an alternative child safety harness – for my own piece of mind.

I use the stroller as much as possible, but then my three year old gets excited about something or thinks he’s Mr. Big Boy and insists on being independent and walking without letting me even hold his hand.

However, when we go to a place with tons of people either for festivals or events, or even at the airport (I travel solo with the boys often) where I need to focus on three or four things at once, I need to know he is next to me.

That’s how I found My Handy Hold.

Benefits of a child safety harness for independent kids

Independence – I’m sure every parent of a two or three year old can understand the need kids of these ages have for complete independence. My three year old doesn’t even like me to hold his hand when crossing the street. My Handy Hold allows my son to walk on his own, technically not hold my hand, but still hold on for safety. He thinks he’s walking on his own.

Affordability – For less than $15 you get this adorable independent tool.

Hands off – I love LOVE when my kids hold my hand. However, when I’m carrying luggage, or groceries, them tugging on my shirt or holding on my elbow simply adds on more weight to me. Not any more! We’re all much happier.

Size and Simplicity- it’s tiny when rolled up. It can fit into any bag and is so easy to simply grab and clip on.

Mother to Mother – Casey, the lady behind My Handy Hold, understands this concept and I prefer to use products that have my child fully in mind.

Where to buy it

Their website is your best bet.  Casey is quick to respond and the item arrives within two days.

Give it a shot, you will be surprised how much fun it is.


Child Safety Harness – A Better Alternative!

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Travel Tips – Granada, Nicaragua
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Granada is one of Nicaragua’s largest cities and a place that all travelers should visit when traveling along the country. Just as any other place you visit in the world there are a couple of curiosities and particularities. Here are [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Granada is one of Nicaragua’s largest cities and a place that all travelers should visit when traveling along the country. Just as any other place you visit in the world there are a couple of curiosities and particularities. Here are a couple of things that I learned from Granada that might be useful for you.

Crime – You don’t hear about horrible crimes happening often. But there is still a guy or two that would love to get a pc, a phone or a camera without having to pay for it. So avoid large crowds or lonely streets at night.

Lodging – Granada has a good variety of places to stay. You shouldn’t have problems with finding a good hotel. I always recommend booking your accommodations before you get to your destination.

Places to Visit – A couple of places in and around Granada that travelers might enjoy are:

  • The Islets
  • Hanging out at the central park
  • Horse carriage ride

Eating – You will find cafes offering sandwiches and other cafeteria dishes for a good price. There are also restaurants offering a variety of dishes. Keep in mind that the restaurants closest to the park tend to be more expensive.

Money – This is not a place where traveling is too expensive, but you should always have some back up Money on a separate account. And if you find yourself on an emergency or need more money you can always look up in the internet for an easy way to finance your trip.

Follow these easy tips that will make your trip a lot easier.

item.title: Health, Yoga and Spa in Guatemala
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Since the country is nestled in between volcanic peaks and crater-filled lakes, you’ll resign to pure tranquility. That is why one of the many things you can do is to pamper yourself with massages, facials, and full- body treatments on a Spa [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Since the country is nestled in between volcanic peaks and crater-filled lakes, you’ll resign to pure tranquility. That is why one of the many things you can do is to pamper yourself with massages, facials, and full- body treatments on a Spa in Guatemala. Also, Guatemala’s yoga and meditation retreats are well-known for theirr magical abilities to fully relax your body and soul.

And if you want to go the extra mile, while you visit Guatemala, check out one of the doctor supervised medi-spas and have a permanent spa treatment applied.

Which type of Spa in Guatemala do you prefer?

*Full Service Spas
* Medi-Spa Day Treatments
* Hot Springs
* Yoga and Meditation Retreats
* Mayan Spas (Chuj)

NOTE: Make sure you check that in the place that you go to the staff is qualified. You don’t want to have an uncomfortable experience while trying to relax.

Finding a place to indulge yourself, relax and rest is not hard at all. The most popular places in the country for experiencing these services are Guatemala City, Antigua and Atitlan. All you have to do is to decide which kind of treatment you want to receive when you visit Guatemala.


Spa in Guatemala – Fun Things to Do on Vacation

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro
